page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN GREAT EASTON
page.content: In Great Easton there are no shops, only one pub and a church.The nearest shop is in Duton Hill but most people shop in Dunmow or Bishop's Stortford. Because of this and a lack of buses most people have a car.We counted the traffic into and out of Great Easton between 1.25pm & 1.55pm on June 11th. We saw 12 cars and 2 vans going to Great Easton & 7 cars, 2 vans,1 lorry, 1 motorbike, leaving. PUBLIC TRANSPORT 42 buses serve Gt.Easton per week. There are 7 a day which are approximately 2 hours apart.Buses go along the Lt.Easton-Tilty road and stop above the ford.There are 7 buses each way Monday-Friday and 5 on Saturdays .Heningham omnibus service 333 runs 1 bus to and from Dunmow on Thursdays,9.55pm-11.45am which stops near the school.
